title: Forget Amsterdam, visit the prettiest town in the Netherlands instead
text:
Home to great art and those prized ceramics, Delft is a Dutch delight off the beaten path.

Go now

The centre of Delft is one of the prettiest and most unspoilt of all Dutch towns – a classic grid of canals lined with lime trees and red-brick houses, many of them dating back to the 17th and 18th centuries.

At its heart is de Markt (1) – the great market square dominated by the town hall and the high steeple of the 15th-century Nieuwe Kerk (the New Church), burial place of the Dutch royal family.

There is no better time to visit than this winter. Delft’s economic and artistic heyday was the 17th century, and no one caught the atmosphere and the detail of everyday life in the city then than the...
